title: Comment on time-variation of fundamental constants
abstract: The possible time variation of dimensionless fundamental constants of nature, such as the fine structure constant $\alpha$, is a legitimate subject of physical enquiry. By contrast, the time variation of dimensional constants, such as $\hbar$, $c$, $G$, $e$, $k$..., which are merely human constructs whose number and values differ from one choice of units to the next, has no operational meaning. To illustrate this, we refute a recent claim of Davies et al that black holes can discriminate between two contending theories of varying $\alpha$, one with varying $c$ and the other with varying $e$. In an Appendix we respond to criticisms by Davies and two {\it Nature} referees.
